column4: Does anyone know of any 'good' network diagraming programs for linux, I can't seem to find anything decent
does that allow creating diagrams, or does it just simply map out the network im on
no just gives you console output of the pcs in a network
im looking for something along the lines of smartdraw or visio, but for linux
that makes it pretty easy to see who is up and resonds, you can scan every thing or just see if a host is up.
sorry, in that case i dont know, you could install crossover office and get visio running, worked pretty well for me.
ive got a copy of smartoffice, but its locked up on my 'mybook' drive right now, which id also like to get working
its connected to my wireless router with an ethernet cable, which makes it wireless,...but beins that im on linux Its not able to pick it up
it also needs special software i beleive, which right now is only windows compatible
what do you want to know?
with nmap is it possible to scan my isps network?
try traceroute www.google.com to see how it works
care if i PM you for a few ?
